reviews.sentence: Great vacation getaway. My wife and I had a wonderful 7day stay at Andaz in San Diego. Beside the great location in walking distance to the major attractions the hotel felt very hospitable and luxurious. We felt pampered because of the attentive and friendly staff the beautiful rooftop pool and restaurant area and all the free stuff provided every day wi fi internet snacks coffee soft drinks and newspapers. The room was really nice with comfortable king bed we slept well and big shower two could fit comfortably to save water of course. We definitely recommend this hotel for couples wanting a nice getaway trip to San Diego.

Great location but. Great hotel. This was the end of our travels so was a place to chill and enjoy San Diego. The pictures looked fab reviews also seemed good so booked it. Reception were very pleasant and rooms very modern. Location could not have been better for the gas lamp however one down side and a big downside was that our room was on the side of the road so during weekends the music did not stop until the very early hours. Now I am not someone who does not like a party but most nights the music blaring. Not for me. However this aside a great hotel lovely wine bar and great roof top bar and pool. I would go back but I would ensure my room was not on the side of the clubs.
Absolutely loved everything about this hotel. The room was nice and the staff was friendly. The rooftop pool is gorgeous.

Staff. The staff are the nicest I ever came across. I asked for 6 water bottles the time was midnight. Within five mins. the delivery was made with a smile and asking if I needed anything else. The hotel supplies bottled water soft drinks and orange juice etc. for free. From the rms to the roof top pool is great and San Diego has a lot to see. Take the jump on off tour bus first so you know the city better. Great VA KAY.

Andaz. Always a great experience. Non conventional high end experience. This hotel is in the perfect location good for Buisnes and close to all the action. A quick Walk to the convention center. Rooftop pool is fantastic and the service it great.

Great hotel in the heart of San Diego. Can not fault the hotel at all. perfectly located in the middle of the gaslamp quarter. The hotel is modern and comfortable with fantastic rooms. The rooftop pool is great. The free refreshment in the mini bar which is topped up daily is a great extra which I have never seen before in a hotel. Highly recommend.

Amazing from start to finish. From the moment we arrived we felt like we were 100 taken care of. Check in was a breeze really appreciated the complimentary wine. We requested a quiet room and we got it. Everything about this hotel is welcoming and well done. The room was small but perfectly positioned. The beds were CRAZY comfortable. The staff were all so friendly and hospitable. It was clear that they really cared about our experience and we so appreciated that. The breakfast outside was perfect and the rooftop pool looked incredible. I will stay at the Andaz when I next return to San Diego and would highly recommend it to others.

Great with one minor issue I have stayed here twice and this is now my favorite place in San Diego. Located right in the Gaslamp District. Walking distance to the San Diego Convention Center and Padres Stadium. Nice roof pool and bar. The first time I stay was in a King Bed room and I really enjoyed it. Good size room with two dresser drawers at the base of the bed. The second time I visited was in a Queen Bed room. My only minor issue was the Queen room had no dresser drawers. So if your clothes could not be hung in the closet you would have to leave it in your bag or laying on the floor. This is not a deal breaker and would book a Queen Bed room if available. Just something to consider if you pick this size room.
Rooftop is awesome. The rooftop pool and bar make this hotel a must stay. Location was very convenient to many restaurants and bars. Reasonable walk to Padres field.

Interesting is the right word. An interesting property. I booked several rooms as we were there for business and one thing that became apparent when looking through the photos are the glass showers like right in the middle of the room. If you are not comfortable with someone watching you shower you can get the two double bed rooms but there is still no solid locking door on the bathroom just a swinging frosted glass one so if it was two guys sharing a room you may feel a little uncomfortable. Otherwise the rooftop was nice the pool was okay the lobby was fun and the hotel is more modern and nice compared to surrounding properties. I had no issues with noise while we were there and I know i read this on other reviews but the area did not seem shady at all.

Sort of disappointed. Got an upgrade to a suite. Staff is SUPER nice and helpful. Room is very clean and well done. Modern. Super comfortable bed and couch. BUT. Room is super dark. It faces inside and basically if you open drapes you are staring right into other rooms that are VERY close. OTOH if you have an exterior room you have a gas lamp noise problem so sorta damned if you do damned if you do not inherent to setup. Towels were oddly sorta cheap. Nit picking I know. Rooftop pool is nice but oddly the rooftop bar does not stay open past 7. it is not obviously under renovation or anything. That was not a big disappointment in the sense that when booking rezie that was clearly delineated but it is just. weird. All in all its just that it seems like it could be just better somehow although it is all just nit picky stuff that docks them. The staff is fantastic I will reiterate.

Great boutique hotel with friendly staff. Stayed here for 5 nights. Funky hotel with generally OK rooms. My room was a little small and they had messed my reservation. so I am not sure I got what I had actually paid for. My friends rooms were better. The selling point is the roof top bar the staff are great and the area is under new management. Things should continue to improve as they update the decor. The pool is average size and lovely to lounge around. Breakfasts are tasty and varied.

Great location and facilities if you are willing to pay for it. The hotel is in a brilliant location for downtown San Diego particularly the Gaslamp Quarter. I also found it easy to walk to the convention centre Balboa Park and the zoo. The room was very nicely decorated like the entire hotel. The bar and pool on the roof were very nice and I particularly enjoyed the fire pit in the colder evenings. Even with a significant discount this hotel was still pretty pricey. I know that San Diego is an expensive city but had I been paying with my own money I probably would have expected more.

Different and nice. Andaz is part of Hyat hotels but the hotel ambience and service is of a small boutique one. Rooms are totally renewed and very comfortable. Roof garden is an excellent choice for dinning swimming or just taking a drink. Restaurant menu was short of options but food was of great quality.

Nice location in Downtown San Diego. This hotel turns a boring business trip into an event. Each evening I would enjoy the facilities on the roof top where there is a full scale view of downtown San Diego. The bar swimming pool and fire pits provide an extra ambience with all the amenities of an outdoor lounge. There is a DJ on Friday and Saturday evenings which create a festive upscale feel different than the downtown Gaslamp district venues. I love this place. The hotel has a boutique feel with upscale clientele. I enjoyed the roof top facilities the most especially in the evenings and on the weekends. The hotel is centrally located to the more common Sand Diego attractions like the zoo the beaches are not too far and the airport is 5 minutes away. The hotel is going through a remodel on some floors so my assumption is that improvement is already underway.

Lovely Hotel excellent location for nightlife. Great modern hotel situated in the heart of the Gaslamp Quarter perfect if you want to be close to the busy nightlife. I had read lots of review about the noise from the streets nearby but we enjoyed a relaxing stay without any issues with noise. The room was modern very clean medium sized but plenty of room for 2 people. Lots of nice treats coffee making machine in the room. Pool area was bijou but very nice with fab rooftop bar area which was really busy at the weekend. Staff were pleasant courteous but a little laid back no complaints but did not add anything to our experience of the hotel. Overall this is a hotel I would recommend.

Pool Bar Service. No pool service as far as someone coming and greeting us at the pool or asked if we wanted a drink or food. My husband and I had to go ourselves to the bar and order our drinks. Also went to the roof top one night to enjoy a drink and the view and again we were not waited on. We asked a server passing by if we can get a drink and she stated we had to go to the bar to get our own drinks which we did. Was dissatisfied with the pool and bar service.

Okay for business travel. This restaurant caters to business travelers and I can not recommend it for leisure travel. There are lots of conference rooms and breakout spaces but very little in the way of common space outside of that. There is only one bar on the rooftop which is usually mobbed with people and because it is near the pool you can only have plastic glasses. The only dining option is also on the rooftop and similarly loud. I do not know if you can have real glasses there. The dining option looks more like a cafeteria than a restaurant though I do not know how good the food is. The pool is a nice size for being in the city but everything around it feels cramped. 70 of the seating is reserved leaving about 10 chairs only for general access. There does not appear to be pool service as we were there for 90 minutes and never saw anyone come by. Guest rooms are nice and well done. Check in was easy and the staff was very friendly. The hotel is pet friendly which I appreciate. I think that they might be planning to open a restaurant on the ground floor soon so when they do that my opinion of whether it is good for personal travel might change.

We stayed there for 3 days during Comic Con. Cool vibe great art great location small rooms. 50 day valet was way overpriced especially when the pool rooftop was unavailable most of the time we were there due to events.

Fancy Hotel did not live up to my expecations. We love staying at Hyat as we have always had a pleasant experience. This is one of them I would not be coming back to. First off the room viewed out to transients sleeping on the sidewalk. We left our curtains closed the whole stay. Our AC unit was not working and even when Facility came to check it out the temp did not improve. The pool in the website looked bigger than actual. The worse experience was valeting our car only to get it back damage and the vendor Ace refuse to fix it and deny our claim via email instead of decent phone call. Amanda Parsi the Office Manager was amazing despite the stay. she is an asset to the company.

One night but would n’t stay here again. Online this hotel looked amazing especially the rooftop pool area which was a deciding factor in finally selecting this hotel. On arrival the receptionist was friendly and was able to check us in slightly early which was great. Although disappointingly we were told that the Rooftop pool was closed to hotel guests for a private event. The room that we booked was a deluxe double room with 2 beds but still on the smallish side. The room carpet had a damp feel and smell to it and we initially thought this was because the bath does not have a solid door that separates the bath from the room just a glass door. Something to note if you like privacy showering and using the toilet. We went to use the iron which was in the closet and water was streaming from the ceiling. We called the front desk and they sent an engineer to check and if they had to move us. They moved us to another room which was great however much smaller than the room we booked where we could n’t even open our luggage. The fact that we had to ring the front desk again for a similar room to the one we had booked was disappointing and an unnecessary hassle. They moved us again but the lady that moved us made us feel like we were putting her out by requesting the room we had booked. On a positive note the staff serving breakfast were great. Overall I would not stay here again nor would I recommend others to stay here especially for the price point. there are many other hotels to chose from.

Modern boutique experience and friendly staff. My wife and I stayed at the Andaz for two nights on a quick weekend visit to San Diego. The hotel is centrally located downtown at the edge of the Gaslamp Quarter and has a modern and sophisticated vibe. All of the main downtown attractions are within walking distance or a short cab ride share away. Upon check in we were offered complimentary drinks before heading to our room on the second floor. We were placed in a queen room on the inner part of the building. According to the floor plan posted on the rooms door it looked like we may have been in the smallest room available. It was tiny. Being an World of Hyat Explorist I was hoping for an upgrade but the room was still clean and comfortable and suited our needs for our short stay. The free in room snacks were a nice touch. Just be warned. the free snacks are in a basket on the desk and are not the snacks located in the mini bar area. If the mini bar is your thing though you have come to the right place as there are many snack and adult beverage offerings available. along with some other amenities. The staff was super friendly. Check in was efficient and we were greeted by lobby staff each time we left the hotel. The front door valet team was helpful in assisting us upon arrival always making sure we had transportation when heading out to explore and they welcomed us back each time we returned. Since our stay was so short we were not able to check out the rooftop pool bar or dine at the on site steak house. This was my first stay at an Andaz property though and it was enjoyable. I like the little touches that make this Hyat brand more like a boutique hotel experience than your normal run of the mill property. We were impressed and would consider staying here again when we return to San Diego.

A great disappointment. We had a suite sweet it was not. The lighting situation was abysmal it took forever to get hot water at the sink the pillows were not great understatement the sleeping and sitting areas were not fully divided the pool area backed onto the highway very noisy.

Good hotel great location. We spent 2 nights here in June. The rooms were clean and nice. Although another couple with us had hair in their shower management took care of situation quickly. Rooms are modern. We were upgraded to a slightly larger king room. As other reviewers noted the shower is glass into the bedroom. There is a curtain you can use it or not. The bathroom is nice but narrow. Hard for 2 people to be in there at once. The pool is nice great rooftop. But the seating at the pool is limited very tiny deck area. Food and drink were good pricey but everything in San Diego is pricey. Reily at the front desk was very helpful and friendly. 5 stars for him. Luis at the rooftop breakfast was also great. Service for breakfast was ridiculously slow until he showed up. He was friendly and responsive.

Summer vacation. The hotel staff was very nice the rooms are noisy at times. The counter tops in the bathrooms were scratched there were holes in the bed comforter the shower faucets was difficult to use. The pool had a private event on a weekend day and was too crowded for guests to use. Went to happy hour at STK rooftop on the first night and it was great. Went again on Sunday night and was told that the happy hour was not available due to a big event there went not any signs stating this and there were less than a dozen people on the rooftop. The streets around the hotel are not pleasant to walk around due to numerous vagrants around and the strong smell of urine was everywhere. This was a problem throughout the downtown area It would be best to avoid walking through the downtown area take a vehicle instead.

Average hotel. We spent one night at this Andaz in the heart of the Gaslamp District in San Diego. Guest of Honor reservation not acknowledged upon check in but it was quickly corrected. Andaz Suite on the 6th floor was spacious quiet and comfortable with the biggest shower stall I ’ve ever seen in a hotel. Good breakfast at The Rooftop restaurant. Underwhelming pool area and gym. I requested extra pillows on the Hyat ap after check in but the request was never processed by hotel staff. The staff seems aloof and even rude like the lady who checked me in. But that seems to be a pattern at Andaz properties. Overall a decent stay at an average hotel.

A great hotel in Gaslamp area beat the bay. Excellent service and rooms. It has a swimming pool and a gym which are not big but serve their purposes. Lots of restaurants around and San Diego bay us only 20 minutes vwalking.

Great hotel. A really nice hotel in downtown San Diego rooms were large clean with the added benefits of free water sodas and snacks on a daily basis. The hotel is very close to the restaurants and bars but do n’t forget to visit the roof to bar and swimming pool. All the staff were helpful friendly and tried to make sure you had all the information you need for both inside ang outside the hotel.
